solution_line_template: If it was {miami_hotter_than_ny} degrees hotter on this day in Miami than in New York, then the temperature in Miami was {temp_new_york}+{miami_hotter_than_ny} = {temp_miami} degrees.

If it was {miami_cooler_than_sd} degrees cooler in Miami than in San Diego, then the temperature in San Diego was {temp_miami}+{miami_cooler_than_sd} = <<{temp_miami}+{miami_cooler_than_sd}={temp_san_diego}>>{temp_san_diego} degrees.
The total temperature for all the cities is {temp_san_diego}+{temp_miami}+{temp_new_york} = <<{temp_san_diego}+{temp_miami}+{temp_new_york}={total_temperature}>>{total_temperature} degrees
The average temperature of the three cities is {total_temperature}/{number_of_cities} = <<{total_temperature}/{number_of_cities}={average_temperature}>>{average_temperature} degrees
